trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Scale Sets allow you to manage multiple VMs as a set.
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Scale Sets allow you to manage multiple VMs as a set.

trans-unit.source: At a high level, scale sets have the following pros and cons:
trans-unit.target: At a high level, scale sets have the following pros and cons:

trans-unit.source: Pros:
trans-unit.target: Pros:

trans-unit.source: High availability.
trans-unit.target: High availability.

trans-unit.source: Each scale set puts its VMs into an Availability Set with 5 Fault Domains (FDs) and 5 Update Domains (UDs) to ensure availability (for more information on FDs and UDs, see [VM availability](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-manage-availability.md)).
trans-unit.target: Each scale set puts its VMs into an Availability Set with 5 Fault Domains (FDs) and 5 Update Domains (UDs) to ensure availability (for more information on FDs and UDs, see [VM availability](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-manage-availability.md)).

trans-unit.source: Easy integration with Azure Load Balancer and App Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Easy integration with Azure Load Balancer and App Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Easy integration with Azure Autoscale.
trans-unit.target: Easy integration with Azure Autoscale.

trans-unit.source: Simplified deployment, management, and clean up of VMs.
trans-unit.target: Simplified deployment, management, and clean up of VMs.

trans-unit.source: Support common Windows and Linux flavors, as well as custom images.
trans-unit.target: Support common Windows and Linux flavors, as well as custom images.

trans-unit.source: Cons:
trans-unit.target: Cons:

trans-unit.source: Cannot attach data disks to VM instances in a scale set.
trans-unit.target: Cannot attach data disks to VM instances in a scale set.

trans-unit.source: Instead, must use Blob Storage, Azure Files, Azure Tables, or other storage solution.
trans-unit.target: Instead, must use Blob Storage, Azure Files, Azure Tables, or other storage solution.

trans-unit.source: Quick-Create Using Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Quick-Create Using Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already, you can get an [Azure subscription free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) and the [Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-install.md) [connected to your Azure account](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md).
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already, you can get an [Azure subscription free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/) and the [Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-install.md) [connected to your Azure account](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md).

trans-unit.source: Once you do, you can run the following commands to quick-create a VM scale set:
trans-unit.target: Once you do, you can run the following commands to quick-create a VM scale set:

trans-unit.source: If you want to customize the location or image-urn, please look into the commands `azure location list` and `azure vm image {list-publishers|list-offers|list-skus|list|show}`.
trans-unit.target: If you want to customize the location or image-urn, please look into the commands `azure location list` and `azure vm image {list-publishers|list-offers|list-skus|list|show}`.

trans-unit.source: Once this command has returned, the scale set will have been created.
trans-unit.target: Once this command has returned, the scale set will have been created.

trans-unit.source: This scale set will have a load balancer with NAT rules mapping port 50,000+i on the load balancer to port 22 on VM i.
trans-unit.target: This scale set will have a load balancer with NAT rules mapping port 50,000+i on the load balancer to port 22 on VM i.

trans-unit.source: Thus, once we figure out the FQDN of the load balancer, we will be able to SSH into our VMs:
trans-unit.target: Thus, once we figure out the FQDN of the load balancer, we will be able to SSH into our VMs:

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: For general information, check out the [main landing page for VM scale sets](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/virtual-machine-scale-sets/).
trans-unit.target: For general information, check out the [main landing page for VM scale sets](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/virtual-machine-scale-sets/).

trans-unit.source: For documentation, check out the [main documentation page for VM scale sets](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-machines-scale-sets/).
trans-unit.target: For documentation, check out the [main documentation page for VM scale sets](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-machines-scale-sets/).

trans-unit.source: For example Azure resource manager templates using VM scale sets, search for "vmss" in the [Azure Quickstart Templates github repo](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates).
trans-unit.target: For example Azure resource manager templates using VM scale sets, search for "vmss" in the [Azure Quickstart Templates github repo](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates).
